Expectation1: Meet sales targets set by management
Situation1: With only an hour left in the shift, they are still a few sales short of the weekly target.
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They are expected to attend every service and take part in church community activities consistently
Story: The clock on my desk blinked 4:00 PM, and my heart pounded with every passing minute. I had just one hour left in my shift, and I was still three sales short of my weekly target. My manager’s words echoed in my mind: “We need you to hit your numbers, or we’ll have to talk about your future here.” I stared at the list of cold leads, knowing I’d have to push hard, maybe even bend the truth a little, to close those last deals. But then my phone buzzed—a reminder for the Wednesday evening church service. I’d promised my pastor and my small group that I’d be there, not just to worship, but to help set up for the community dinner. My faith teaches me to be honest, to serve others, and to keep my commitments. But the pressure to keep my job, to not let my team down, was crushing. I felt torn in two, my hands trembling as I weighed the demands of my work against the call of my faith, knowing I couldn’t be in both places at once.
